content.description:
Start matched on the lowest holds and work up and right to a tooth-shaped flake and a series of sloping holds before working back left to a rail and jugs at the top. Perhaps best done when conditions are cooler so the slopers feel more usable.

Rated V4 in the Tram Bouldering Guide but it seems easier than the problem just to the left.
content.location:
Right side of the North face and just right of

Tourist Remover

.

content.description:
SDS at an incut flake and work up and left along the sloping arete, sometimes with good holds and sometimes not, until the slab on the right merges with the vertical face. Exiting right onto the slab is possible at any point but the higher you go the better.

It's possible to continue left at the top and finish with the last moves of

Trailside Tango

for a slightly harder finish.

Listed in the Tram Bouldering Guide as #81, Unnamed.
content.location: Right side of the north face and just right of Just Another Trailside Attraction.

content.description:
A tricky start with holds that aren't as good as you'd like eases to steep slab with good edges and an easy topout.

Listed in the Tram Bouldering Guide as #77, Unnamed.
content.location:
Right side of the east face and just right of

Tourist Trophy

.

content.description:
Climbs the prominent right-slanting crack using a combination of jams, edges and jugs to a high but easy topout.

This problem isn't listed in the Tram Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location: Left side of the east face and just right of a pine tree.

content.description:
Start off a rock at the base and pull onto the steep face using a decent left hand and a super-incut black flake for the right. Feet up on small holds and then work up sloping edges with tricky feet to a good hold near the top. Technical and balancy moves throughout which makes a spot a good idea.

Listed in the Tram Bouldering Guide as #78, Unnamed.
content.location:
Left side of the north face and just left of

Trailside Tango

.

content.description:
This variation starts up

Trailside Tango

and then partway up that problem cuts right to join

Trail Rail

for it's finish.
content.location: Right side of the north face.

content.description: The Chris Miller Memorial Roof Problem, that is. Lay down start under a roof, with a good rail for the left, and a thin crimp for the right. Pull the short roof on sloping jugs.
content.protection: A pad to protect your back whilst laying down at the start.
content.location:
This shorty is found on a small boulder 10 yards south of RR#3. Left if looking at

Trailside Tango

.
